path: 40_Experiments/Grammer checkor/Raw/1. Claude - Grammar Checker Error List for C1-Level Cantonese.docx
text: Grammar Checker Error List for C1-Level Cantonese ESL Speakers Article Errors Error Type: Missing Definite Article Minimal Pair: "I went to library yesterday" / "I went to the library yesterday" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Missing Indefinite Article Minimal Pair: "He is teacher" / "He is a teacher" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Unnecessary Article with Plural Generics Minimal Pair: "The dogs are loyal animals" / "Dogs are loyal animals" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Article with Uncountable Nouns Minimal Pair: "I need an information" / "I need information" Action: Flag and explain Plural Marking Errors Error Type: Missing Plural -s Minimal Pair: "Three book" / "Three books" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Double Plural Marking Minimal Pair: "Many peoples" / "Many people" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Irregular Plural Formation Minimal Pair: "Two childs" / "Two children" Action: Flag and explain Subject-Verb Agreement Errors Error Type: Third Person Singular -s Missing Minimal Pair: "She work here" / "She works here" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Incorrect Agreement with Collective Nouns Minimal Pair: "The team are ready" (AmE) / "The team is ready" Action: Flag only (dialect variation) Error Type: Agreement with Quantifiers Minimal Pair: "Each of them have" / "Each of them has" Action: Flag and explain Verb Tense Errors Error Type: Missing Past Tense Marker Minimal Pair: "Yesterday I go shopping" / "Yesterday I went shopping" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Incorrect Present Perfect Usage Minimal Pair: "I am living here for 5 years" / "I have lived here for 5 years" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Simple Past vs Present Perfect Minimal Pair: "Did you eat lunch yet?" / "Have you eaten lunch yet?" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Future Time Expression with Present Tense Minimal Pair: "Tomorrow I go to work" / "Tomorrow I will go to work" Action: Flag and explain Aspect Errors Error Type: Missing Progressive Aspect Minimal Pair: "She cooks now" (when action is ongoing) / "She is cooking now" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Stative Verb in Progressive Minimal Pair: "I am knowing the answer" / "I know the answer" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Perfect Aspect with Time Adverbial Minimal Pair: "I have finished it yesterday" / "I finished it yesterday" Action: Flag and explain Modal Verb Errors Error Type: Double Modals Minimal Pair: "Will can you help?" / "Can you help?" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Modal + Infinitive with 'to' Minimal Pair: "You should to go" / "You should go" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Past Modal Formation Minimal Pair: "You should went" / "You should have gone" Action: Flag and explain Preposition Errors Error Type: Wrong Preposition (Time) Minimal Pair: "In Monday" / "On Monday" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Preposition (Place) Minimal Pair: "In the bus" / "On the bus" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Preposition (Dependent) Minimal Pair: "Depend of" / "Depend on" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Missing Preposition Minimal Pair: "Listen the music" / "Listen to the music" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Unnecessary Preposition Minimal Pair: "Discuss about the issue" / "Discuss the issue" Action: Flag and explain Word Order Errors Error Type: Adverb Placement Minimal Pair: "He drives carefully always" / "He always drives carefully" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Adjective Order Minimal Pair: "A wooden old table" / "An old wooden table" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Question Word Order Minimal Pair: "Where you went?" / "Where did you go?" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Indirect Question Word Order Minimal Pair: "I wonder where is he" / "I wonder where he is" Action: Flag and explain Relative Clause Errors Error Type: Missing Relative Pronoun Minimal Pair: "The book I bought it" / "The book I bought" OR "The book that I bought" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Resumptive Pronoun Minimal Pair: "The person who I met him" / "The person who I met" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Relative Pronoun Minimal Pair: "The place who I visited" / "The place that/which I visited" Action: Flag and explain Passive Voice Errors Error Type: Missing 'be' in Passive Minimal Pair: "The house built in 1990" / "The house was built in 1990" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Passive with Intransitive Verb Minimal Pair: "The accident was happened" / "The accident happened" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Participle Form Minimal Pair: "It was write" / "It was written" Action: Flag and explain Gerund vs Infinitive Errors Error Type: Wrong Form after Verb Minimal Pair: "I enjoy to read" / "I enjoy reading" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Form after Verb (opposite) Minimal Pair: "I want reading" / "I want to read" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Form after Preposition Minimal Pair: "I'm interested in to learn" / "I'm interested in learning" Action: Flag and explain Countability Errors Error Type: Uncountable Treated as Countable Minimal Pair: "An advice" / "A piece of advice" OR "Some advice" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Quantifier for Countable Minimal Pair: "Much people" / "Many people" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Quantifier for Uncountable Minimal Pair: "Many money" / "Much money" Action: Flag and explain Comparative and Superlative Errors Error Type: Double Comparative Minimal Pair: "More better" / "Better" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Missing 'than' in Comparison Minimal Pair: "She is taller from me" / "She is taller than me" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Wrong Superlative Form Minimal Pair: "The most good" / "The best" Action: Flag and explain Conditional Errors Error Type: Wrong Tense in If-Clause Minimal Pair: "If I will have time" / "If I have time" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Mixed Conditional Types Minimal Pair: "If I knew, I will tell you" / "If I knew, I would tell you" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Impossible Condition Formation Minimal Pair: "If I was you" / "If I were you" Action: Flag and explain Redundancy Errors Error Type: Double Negative Minimal Pair: "I don't have nothing" / "I don't have anything" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Redundant Subject Minimal Pair: "My brother he is tall" / "My brother is tall" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Redundant 'More' with Comparative Minimal Pair: "More easier" / "Easier" Action: Flag and explain Pronoun Errors Error Type: Subject-Object Pronoun Confusion Minimal Pair: "Between you and I" / "Between you and me" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Reflexive Pronoun Misuse Minimal Pair: "Myself did it" / "I did it" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Possessive vs Possessive Pronoun Minimal Pair: "That book is my" / "That book is mine" Action: Flag and explain Register and Formality Errors Error Type: Informal in Professional Context Minimal Pair: "Wanna discuss this?" (in email to boss) / "Would you like to discuss this?" Action: Flag only Error Type: Overly Formal in Casual Context Minimal Pair: "I shall be there" (to friend) / "I'll be there" Action: Flag only Error Type: Contractions in Formal Writing Minimal Pair: "The report doesn't show..." (academic) / "The report does not show..." Action: Flag only Sentence Fragment and Run-on Errors Error Type: Sentence Fragment Minimal Pair: "Because I was tired." (standalone) / "I left early because I was tired." Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Comma Splice Minimal Pair: "I was tired~~,~~ I went home" / "I was tired, so I went home" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Run-on Sentence Minimal Pair: "I went homeI was tired" / "I went home because I was tired" Action: Flag and explain Reported Speech Errors Error Type: Wrong Tense Backshift Minimal Pair: "He said he is tired" / "He said he was tired" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: No Change in Time Adverbials Minimal Pair: "She said she would come tomorrow" / "She said she would come the next day" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Question Form in Reported Question Minimal Pair: "He asked where is she" / "He asked where she was" Action: Flag and explain Punctuation with Grammar Impact Error Type: Missing Comma in Non-Restrictive Clause Minimal Pair: "My brotherwho lives in London" / "My brother, who lives in London," Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Missing Apostrophe in Possessive Minimal Pair: "The students~~ books~~" / "The students' books" Action: Flag and explain Error Type: Its vs It's Minimal Pair: "Its raining" / "It's raining" Action: Flag and explain Grammar Checker Error List for C1 Cantonese ESL Speakers Article Errors Flag and Explain: Missing definite article: "I went to library yesterday" → "I went to the library yesterday" Missing indefinite article: "He is teacher" → "He is a teacher" Unnecessary article with plural generalizations: "The dogs are loyal animals" → "Dogs are loyal animals" Article with uncountable nouns: "I need an information" → "I need information" Article with proper nouns: "The Hong Kong is busy" → "Hong Kong is busy" Article with abstract nouns: "The happiness is important" → "Happiness is important" Flag Only: Zero article with institutions (idiomatic): "She is at the home" → "She is at home" Plural Marking Errors Flag and Explain: Missing plural -s: "Three book" → "Three books" Double plural marking: "Many peoples" → "Many people" Irregular plural formation: "Two childs" → "Two children" Flag Only: None Subject-Verb Agreement Errors Flag and Explain: Third person singular -s missing: "She work here" → "She works here" Agreement with quantifiers: "Each of them have" → "Each of them has" Flag Only: Collective nouns (dialect variation): "The team are ready" → "The team is ready" Verb Tense Errors Flag and Explain: Missing past tense marker: "Yesterday I go shopping" → "Yesterday I went shopping" Incorrect present perfect usage: "I am living here for 5 years" → "I have lived here for 5 years" Simple past vs present perfect: "Did you eat lunch yet?" → "Have you eaten lunch yet?" Future time expression with present tense: "Tomorrow I go to work" → "Tomorrow I will go to work" Flag Only: None Aspect Errors Flag and Explain: Missing progressive aspect: "She cooks now" → "She is cooking now" Stative verb in progressive: "I am knowing the answer" → "I know the answer" Perfect aspect with definite past time: "I have finished it yesterday" → "I finished it yesterday" Flag Only: None Modal Verb Errors Flag and Explain: Double modals: "Will can you help?" → "Can you help?" Modal + infinitive with 'to': "You should to go" → "You should go" Past modal formation: "You should went" → "You should have gone" Flag Only: None Preposition Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong preposition (time): "In Monday" → "On Monday" Wrong preposition (place): "In the bus" → "On the bus" Wrong preposition (dependent): "Depend of" → "Depend on" Missing preposition: "Listen the music" → "Listen to the music" Unnecessary preposition: "Discuss about the issue" → "Discuss the issue" Flag Only: None Word Order Errors Flag and Explain: Adverb placement: "He drives carefully always" → "He always drives carefully" Adjective order: "A wooden old table" → "An old wooden table" Question word order: "Where you went?" → "Where did you go?" Indirect question word order: "I wonder where is he" → "I wonder where he is" Flag Only: None Relative Clause Errors Flag and Explain: Resumptive pronoun: "The person who I met him" → "The person who I met" Wrong relative pronoun: "The place who I visited" → "The place that I visited" Missing relative pronoun (with resumptive): "The book I bought it" → "The book I bought" Flag Only: None Passive Voice Errors Flag and Explain: Missing 'be' in passive: "The house built in 1990" → "The house was built in 1990" Passive with intransitive verb: "The accident was happened" → "The accident happened" Wrong participle form: "It was write" → "It was written" Flag Only: None Gerund vs Infinitive Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong form after verb: "I enjoy to read" → "I enjoy reading" Wrong form after verb (opposite): "I want reading" → "I want to read" Wrong form after preposition: "I'm interested in to learn" → "I'm interested in learning" Flag Only: None Countability Errors Flag and Explain: Uncountable treated as countable: "An advice" → "A piece of advice" OR "Some advice" Wrong quantifier for countable: "Much people" → "Many people" Wrong quantifier for uncountable: "Many money" → "Much money" Flag Only: None Comparative and Superlative Errors Flag and Explain: Double comparative: "More better" → "Better" Missing 'than' in comparison: "She is taller from me" → "She is taller than me" Wrong superlative form: "The most good" → "The best" Flag Only: None Conditional Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong tense in if-clause: "If I will have time" → "If I have time" Mixed conditional types: "If I knew, I will tell you" → "If I knew, I would tell you" Impossible condition formation: "If I was you" → "If I were you" Flag Only: None Redundancy Errors Flag and Explain: Double negative: "I don't have nothing" → "I don't have anything" Redundant subject: "My brother he is tall" → "My brother is tall" Redundant 'more' with comparative: "More easier" → "Easier" Flag Only: None Pronoun Errors Flag and Explain: Subject-object pronoun confusion: "Between you and I" → "Between you and me" Reflexive pronoun misuse: "Myself did it" → "I did it" Possessive vs possessive pronoun: "That book is my" → "That book is mine" Flag Only: None Register and Formality Errors Flag and Explain: None Flag Only: Informal in professional context: "Wanna discuss this?" → "Would you like to discuss this?" Overly formal in casual context: "I shall be there" → "I'll be there" Contractions in formal writing: "The report doesn't show" → "The report does not show" Sentence Structure Errors Flag and Explain: Sentence fragment: "Because I was tired." → "I left early because I was tired." Comma splice: "I was tired, I went home" → "I was tired, so I went home" Run-on sentence: "I went home I was tired" → "I went home because I was tired" Flag Only: None Reported Speech Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong tense backshift: "He said he is tired" → "He said he was tired" No change in time adverbials: "She said she would come tomorrow" → "She said she would come the next day" Question form in reported question: "He asked where is she" → "He asked where she was" Flag Only: None Punctuation Errors with Grammar Impact Flag and Explain: Missing comma in non-restrictive clause: "My brother who lives in London" → "My brother, who lives in London," Missing apostrophe in possessive: "The students books" → "The students' books" Its vs it's confusion: "Its raining" → "It's raining" Flag Only: None ⁂ Grammar Checker Error List for C1 Cantonese ESL Speakers Article Errors Flag and Explain: Missing definite article: "I went to library yesterday" → "I went to the library yesterday" Missing indefinite article: "He is teacher" → "He is a teacher" Unnecessary article with plural generalizations: "The dogs are loyal animals" → "Dogs are loyal animals" Article with uncountable nouns: "I need an information" → "I need information" Article with proper nouns: "The Hong Kong is busy" → "Hong Kong is busy" Article with abstract nouns: "The happiness is important" → "Happiness is important" Flag Only: Zero article with institutions (idiomatic): "She is at the home" → "She is at home" Plural Marking Errors Flag and Explain: Missing plural -s: "Three book" → "Three books" Double plural marking: "Many peoples" → "Many people" Irregular plural formation: "Two childs" → "Two children" Flag Only: None Subject-Verb Agreement Errors Flag and Explain: Third person singular -s missing: "She work here" → "She works here" Agreement with quantifiers: "Each of them have" → "Each of them has" Flag Only: Collective nouns (dialect variation): "The team are ready" → "The team is ready" Verb Tense Errors Flag and Explain: Missing past tense marker: "Yesterday I go shopping" → "Yesterday I went shopping" Incorrect present perfect usage: "I am living here for 5 years" → "I have lived here for 5 years" Simple past vs present perfect: "Did you eat lunch yet?" → "Have you eaten lunch yet?" Future time expression with present tense: "Tomorrow I go to work" → "Tomorrow I will go to work" Flag Only: None Aspect Errors Flag and Explain: Missing progressive aspect: "She cooks now" → "She is cooking now" Stative verb in progressive: "I am knowing the answer" → "I know the answer" Perfect aspect with definite past time: "I have finished it yesterday" → "I finished it yesterday" Flag Only: None Modal Verb Errors Flag and Explain: Double modals: "Will can you help?" → "Can you help?" Modal + infinitive with 'to': "You should to go" → "You should go" Past modal formation: "You should went" → "You should have gone" Flag Only: None Copula and Auxiliary Errors Flag and Explain: Missing copula "be": "She happy" → "She is happy" Missing auxiliary in negatives: "He not go" → "He doesn't go" Missing auxiliary in questions: "You want coffee?" → "Do you want coffee?" Unnecessary copula with main verb: "I am agree" → "I agree" Missing dummy subject: "Is raining" → "It is raining" Flag Only: None Preposition Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong preposition (time): "In Monday" → "On Monday" Wrong preposition (place): "In the bus" → "On the bus" Wrong preposition (dependent): "Depend of" → "Depend on" Missing preposition: "Listen the music" → "Listen to the music" Unnecessary preposition: "Discuss about the issue" → "Discuss the issue" Flag Only: None Word Order Errors Flag and Explain: Adverb placement: "He drives carefully always" → "He always drives carefully" Adjective order: "A wooden old table" → "An old wooden table" Question word order: "Where you went?" → "Where did you go?" Indirect question word order: "I wonder where is he" → "I wonder where he is" Flag Only: None Relative Clause Errors Flag and Explain: Resumptive pronoun: "The person who I met him" → "The person who I met" Wrong relative pronoun: "The place who I visited" → "The place that I visited" Missing relative pronoun (with resumptive): "The book I bought it" → "The book I bought" Flag Only: None Passive Voice Errors Flag and Explain: Missing 'be' in passive: "The house built in 1990" → "The house was built in 1990" Passive with intransitive verb: "The accident was happened" → "The accident happened" Wrong participle form: "It was write" → "It was written" Flag Only: None Gerund vs Infinitive Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong form after verb: "I enjoy to read" → "I enjoy reading" Wrong form after verb (opposite): "I want reading" → "I want to read" Wrong form after preposition: "I'm interested in to learn" → "I'm interested in learning" Wrong form with causatives: "I made him to go" → "I made him go" Flag Only: None Countability Errors Flag and Explain: Uncountable treated as countable: "An advice" → "A piece of advice" OR "Some advice" Wrong quantifier for countable: "Much people" → "Many people" Wrong quantifier for uncountable: "Many money" → "Much money" Flag Only: None Comparative and Superlative Errors Flag and Explain: Double comparative: "More better" → "Better" Missing 'than' in comparison: "She is taller from me" → "She is taller than me" Wrong superlative form: "The most good" → "The best" Wrong structure with "as...as": "as tall than me" → "as tall as me" Flag Only: None Conditional Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong tense in if-clause: "If I will have time" → "If I have time" Mixed conditional types: "If I knew, I will tell you" → "If I knew, I would tell you" Impossible condition formation: "If I was you" → "If I were you" Flag Only: None Redundancy Errors Flag and Explain: Double negative: "I don't have nothing" → "I don't have anything" Redundant subject: "My brother he is tall" → "My brother is tall" Redundant 'more' with comparative: "More easier" → "Easier" Flag Only: None Pronoun Errors Flag and Explain: Subject-object pronoun confusion: "Between you and I" → "Between you and me" Reflexive pronoun misuse: "Myself did it" → "I did it" Possessive vs possessive pronoun: "That book is my" → "That book is mine" Missing subject pronoun: "Is very cold today" → "It is very cold today" Flag Only: None Register and Formality Errors Flag and Explain: None Flag Only: Informal in professional context: "Wanna discuss this?" → "Would you like to discuss this?" Overly formal in casual context: "I shall be there" → "I'll be there" Contractions in formal writing: "The report doesn't show" → "The report does not show" Sentence Structure Errors Flag and Explain: Sentence fragment: "Because I was tired." → "I left early because I was tired." Comma splice: "I was tired, I went home" → "I was tired, so I went home" Run-on sentence: "I went home I was tired" → "I went home because I was tired" Dangling modifier: "Walking down the street, the trees were beautiful" → "Walking down the street, I saw beautiful trees" Misplaced modifier: "I only ate pizza yesterday" (meaning unclear) → "I ate only pizza yesterday" OR "I ate pizza only yesterday" Flag Only: None Reported Speech Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong tense backshift: "He said he is tired" → "He said he was tired" No change in time adverbials: "She said she would come tomorrow" → "She said she would come the next day" Question form in reported question: "He asked where is she" → "He asked where she was" Flag Only: None Existential Constructions Flag and Explain: "Have" instead of "there is/are": "Have many people here" → "There are many people here" Missing "there" in existential: "Are many options" → "There are many options" Flag Only: None Participial Adjective Errors Flag and Explain: -ing vs -ed confusion: "I am boring" (when meaning bored) → "I am bored" Wrong participle with feeling: "The news was shocking me" → "The news shocked me" OR "I was shocked by the news" Flag Only: None Verb Pattern Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong pattern with "suggest": "I suggest to go" → "I suggest going" Wrong pattern with "recommend": "I recommend you to try" → "I recommend that you try" OR "I recommend trying" Adjective used as adverb: "He runs quick" → "He runs quickly" Flag Only: None Wish vs Hope Errors Flag and Explain: "Hope" with unreal past: "I hope I had more time" (impossible) → "I wish I had more time" "Wish" with future possibility: "I wish it will rain tomorrow" → "I hope it will rain tomorrow" Flag Only: None Collocation Errors Flag and Explain: Do vs make: "make homework" → "do homework" Say vs tell: "He said me" → "He told me" High vs tall: "a high person" → "a tall person" Flag Only: None Tag Question Errors Flag and Explain: Wrong polarity in tag: "You're ready, aren't you?" (correct) vs "You're ready, are you?" (wrong context) Wrong auxiliary in tag: "She went home, doesn't she?" → "She went home, didn't she?" Flag Only: None Parallel Structure Errors Flag and Explain: Inconsistent structure in list: "I like swimming, to run, and biking" → "I like swimming, running, and biking" Inconsistent structure in comparison: "It's better to wait than rushing" → "It's better to wait than to rush" Flag Only: None Inversion Errors Flag and Explain: Missing inversion after negative adverbials: "Never I have seen this" → "Never have I seen this" Missing inversion with "only": "Only then I understood" → "Only then did I understand" Flag Only: None Punctuation Errors with Grammar Impact Flag and Explain: Missing comma in non-restrictive clause: "My brother who lives in London" → "My brother, who lives in London," Missing apostrophe in possessive: "The students books" → "The students' books" Its vs it's confusion: "Its raining" → "It's raining" Flag Only: None image.jpg
